column4: i have a general question for those who use linux to produce music. Is there any reason why Qtractor or any of the midi sequencers do not recognise my Yamaha keyboard? do i need to do anything special? im rather new to Linux in general
which yahama series is it?
dgx-620
type in the terminal lspci
done i have loads of lines there which could be written in chinesse to me (
lol why are you typing make for?
please refer it in here
there it is Bus 004 Device 007: ID 0499:1039 Yamaha Corp.
now run Qtractor in the Terminal
done
http://paste.ubuntu.com/778936/ is that wat you are asking for?
adduser user audio
shall i type it in terminal? hope you wont get angry but u r dealing with complete noob here
yes sudo adduser username audio that will add your user name  to the audio list log out and come back and you should be available to use the device now
i typed sudo-adduser pogarda audio and nothing happened shall i log out now?
i done it and still terminal cursor jumps to the next line - nothins is happening. Should i restart my comp now or again due to my ignorance ive done something wrong?
YAY! ive done it again and it gave me output http://paste.ubuntu.com/778955/
thx ill restart now brb
still Qtractor seems to do not tame a single note from yamaha.
try this sudo apt-get install rosegarden
try Ubuntu Software Center
then Read ;) on ubuntu.com
thx for the Rose! it recognises my Yamaha and it plays notes from pattern on it! To do not waiste any more of your time ill work out on my own now how to make it also read XD
read this http://noisyheron.wordpress.com/2009/04/05/running-vst-plugins-on-ubuntu-linux-by-building-ardour-with-vst-support/
